intro: Amomum sulcatum, commonly known as the rough-ridged cardamom, is a tropical herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the ginger family (Zingiberaceae) and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and clustered, pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, three-lobed berries that contain aromatic seeds used in traditional medicine and culinary applications. Its rhizomes are also valued for their medicinal properties, including anti-inflammatory and digestive benefits. Amomum sulcatum thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated for its aromatic compounds.
